msContents.summary: Scripture by various authors known as New Testament [n]

objectDesc.p: Papyrus, 25x20, 31 extant leaf(s), 1 column(s), 33-36 line(s) per column, 44-54 characters per line, written in Greek.

handDesc.handNote: 200-224 Original scribe with reformed documentary hand (825 verses).

history.provenance: Excavated at Atfîḥ, Miṣr in the ruins of a monastery.
[1,3-31] Purchased 1931 by Chester Beatty at Al Qāhirah, Miṣr from antiquities dealer.
[1,3-31] Transferred 1950 to Chester Beatty Library at Dublin, Ireland.
[2] Purchased 1930 by H. Junker, Österreichische Nationalbibliothek (Austrian National Library).
[2] Transferred 1930 to Österreichische Nationalbibliothek (Austrian National Library) at Wien, Österreich.

msIdentifier.msName: [1,3-31] BP I, Chester Beatty Library, Dublin, Ireland.
[2] Pap. G. 31974, Österreichische Nationalbibliothek (Austrian National Library), Wien, Österreich.

sourceDesc.bibl: [1,3-31] Kenyon, Frederic G., The Chester Beatty Biblical Papyri: Fasciculus II/1, The Gospels and Acts, Text, Emery Walker: London, England, 1933. OCLC 1097140.

[2] Gerstinger, Hans, “Ein Fragment des Chester Beatty-Evangelicnkodex in der Papyrussammlung der Nationalbibliothek in Wien”, Aegyptus : Rivista italiana di egittologia e di papirologia, vol. 13, no. 1, p. 67-73, Gemeli: Milano, Italia, 1933. OCLC 819017100.
